BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CALIFORNIA RURAL INDIAN HEALTH BOARD INC

IRS990.Desc: DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE/INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES:THROUGH ITS SUBRECIPIENT HEALTH CLINICS, CALIFORNIA RURAL INDIAN HEALTH BOARD, INC (CRIHB) PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH SERVICES TO THE INDIAN POPULATION OF INYO, MONO, SHASTA, TUOLUMNE, TULARE, MODOC, SONOMA, MENDOCINO, DEL NORTE AND HUMBOLDT (EXCLUDING THE HUPA SERVICE AREA AND ORLEANS) COUNTIES OF CALIFORNIA. COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH SERVICES INCLUDE GENERAL MEDICINE, INTERNAL MEDICINE, PEDIATRICS, OBSTETRICS, GYNECOLOGY, AMBULATORY SURGERY, PRENATAL CARE, WELL CHILD CARE INCLUDING IMMUNIZATIONS, HEALTH PROMOTION/DISEASE PREVENTION, CHRONIC DISEASE SUPERVISION OF ILLNESS SUCH AS DIABETES, HYPERTENSION, ARTHRITIS, ETC. ALSO INCLUDED ARE PUBLIC HEALTH ORIENTED DENTAL PROGRAMS (PROMOTION, MAINTENANCE, RESTORATION AND PREVENTION) AND MENTAL HEALTH/SOCIAL SERVICES PROGRAMS. PROGRAM EXPENDITURES ARE AS FOLLOWS:HEALTH CLINICS: $39,736,927DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES/INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES:THE OBJECTIVES OF THE HEAD START CHILD CARE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS IS TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH, EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL AND OTHER SERVICES PRIMARILY TO ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PRESCHOOL CHILDREN SO THAT THE CHILDREN WILL ATTAIN OVERALL SOCIAL COMPETENCE. PARENTS ALSO PARTICIPATED IN VARIOUS DECISION-MAKING PROCESSES RELATED TO THE OPEARATIONS OF THE PROGRAM. PROGRAM EXPENDITURES ARE AS FOLLOWS:HEAD START PROGRAM $ 997,555 CHILD CARE DEVELOPMENT 934,797TOTAL EXPENDITURES $ 1,932,352OTHER PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENDITURES ARE AS FOLLOWS: CDC INJURY PREVENTION $ 27,132 CA TRIBAL EPIDEMIOLOGY CENTER 537,961 SUBSTANCE ABUSE & MENTAL HEALTH 443,829 NIHB 86,618 DENTAL 263,787MAA 625,764 CRIHB CARE OPTIONS 1,239,877CDC ACORNS 1,015,029 LYTTON FIRST STEPS 229,486OTHER 2,359,691TOTAL EXPENDITURES $ 6,829,174

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CRIHB HAS APPLIED THE ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE IS NO MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WITH SOME EXCEPTIONS, CRIHB IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2014.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANDREA CAZARES-DIEGO IS MOTHER OF ANGELA MARTIN. CLOIS ERWIN IS GRANDMOTHER OF MARCUS BLIND.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT DELEGATE AUTHORITY TO ANY COMMITEE TO ACT ON ITS BEHALF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTOR OF FINANCE (CFO) AND THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER REVIEW THE RETURN AND COMPARE IT TO THE AUDIT REPORT FOR THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS OUTLINED IN CRIHB'S PERSONNEL POLICIES AND IS ANNUALLY ENFORCED AND MONITORED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD REVIEWS DATA FROM SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS AND PROVIDES COMPENSATION COMMENSURATE WITH EXPERIENCE, FUNDING AND PRIOR YEAR BASE. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE DIRECTS REQUESTS FOR SUCH INFORMATION BE MADE TO CRIHB'S OFFICE.
NEITHER THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT NOR THE PROCESS FOR SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
